title: Kate Wright 'feeling flat' after wedding as Rio Ferdinand is back to work
text:
The newly weds looked so happy during their celebration (Picture: Instagram)

Kate Wright has been left feeling a bit ‘flat’ after her wedding to former footballer Rio Ferdinand was over so quickly.

The now Mrs Ferdinand was left ‘feeling flat’ after her new husband had to jet back to he UK just three days after they tied the knot.

Kate and Rio had a blissful wedding at a luxury resort in Turkey but the entire celebration and honeymoon only lasted for 72 hours as unfortunately Rio, 40, had to return to his job as a football commentator with BT Sport.

And it’s left Kate feeling a bit rubbish.

The new Mr and Mrs Ferdinand have been melting our hearts ever since they were first rumored to be dating in January 2017 so we expected them to have a massive wedding and a hefty honeymoon to enjoy some quality time together after getting hitched.

You can imagine our shock when former England footballer Rio suddenly appeared to be back to commentating on the football just three days after he tied the knot.

Kate, 28, seems to be pushing through but we’re not surprised she’s feeling a bit flat after such a wonderful celebration had to end so quickly.

The insider told Heat the wedding was ‘a magical, beautiful, three-day affair and Kate can’t believe its already over’.

They added: ‘There wasn’t a dry eye in the house when Kate walked in, and Rio said he felt like the luckiest man in the world.

‘Partying continued into the next day and no-one wanted to leave, which made it even harder when Rio returned to work so quickly – Kate can’t help but feel a little flat.’

When host Gary Lineker asked Rio on air ‘shouldn’t you be on your honeymoon?’ the former football champion agreed that ‘football is the priority’.

The pair started dating in 2017 (Picture: Getty Images for FENDI)

He added that Kate ‘knows that’.

Luckily, it seems Kate has new dreams to turn her attention to and help her get over post-wedding blues.

The newlyweds have made it no secret that they want to have children together.

Advertisement

Heat’s insider said: ‘Kate is up for having a big family, and is excited about Rio’s kids having a new brother or sister within a year.’

The former Towie star became stepmum to Rio’s three children, Lorenzo, 13, Tate, 11 and Tia, seven, after their mother, Rebecca, died in 2015.
